channel.title: Webclient help ._
channel.description: So hayy, i made a webclient again... but its fucking up -.-, i can logg into server from origin desktop client.. with my normal ip.. then when i logg on webclient it say i connect from 127.0.0.1.. And ive changed my ip 6000 times still does the same. Anyone know how to fix that?

item.title: Webclient help ._
item.dc:creator: @Spud_pickles Spud pickles
item.description:
@Spud_pickles wrote:

search server.java in your source, search 0.0.0.0, or no-ip.org you must also change that .

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient help ._
item.dc:creator: @ltxwolf ltxwolf
item.description:
@ltxwolf wrote:

[quote=“Dunder Mifflin, post:6, topic:422060”]speak proper english so we can understand you. your speaking it improper. ex. using dont instead of didnt. Listen. Explain it clear so we can help ok? and learn to compile?[/quote]I do know how to compile, but it doesnt connect with my ip on jarred client. i have checked the files in client.jar and they’re set to my IP. But still it does not connect. //Do you understand that then?

Read full topic

item.description:
@Dunder_Mifflin1 wrote:

speak proper english so we can understand you. your speaking it improper. ex. using dont instead of didnt. Listen. Explain it clear so we can help ok? and learn to compile?

item.title: Webclient help ._
item.dc:creator: @ltxwolf ltxwolf
item.description:
@ltxwolf wrote:

[quote=“Spud pickles, post:4, topic:422060”][quote author=ltxwolf link=topic=524740.msg3819456#msg3819456 date=1321650868]

Compile…
[/quote]O.o, you don’t think i compile? When i jar and use the client.jar it uses 127.0.0.1 “localhost” instead of server ip.

why would u jar a client on local host anyways?[/quote]GAHHH i dont! i jarred it with my normal ip…

Read full topic
